abstract.text: A unit of measure for quantities of information.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to represent quantities of information using the
class. The base unit of measure for information is the bit, with a nibble representing four bits and a byte representing eight bits.
Larger units of information expand on bits and bytes by orders of magnitude in both decimal and binary forms.
Units of bits commonly represent the amount of transferred information.
Units of bytes commonly represent the amount of stored information.
